junit.textui
Class SelectionResultPrinter

java.lang.Object
  junit.textui.SelectionResultPrinter
All Implemented Interfaces:
SelectionTestListener, junit.framework.TestListener
public class SelectionResultPrinter
extends java.lang.Object
implements SelectionTestListener

Test listener and printer which tracks test case numbers, and provides facilities for storing outputs, tracing instrumented test cases, and diffing outputs.

Version:
06/21/2006
Author:
Alex Kinneer

Field Detail

classLvl

protected boolean classLvl
Flag which specifies whether the test case granularity is method level or class level. Method level is used by default.

Constructor Detail

SelectionResultPrinter

public SelectionResultPrinter()
Default constructor, creates a result printer which directs output to stdout and has no special configuration.

SelectionResultPrinter

public SelectionResultPrinter(java.io.Writer writer,
                              java.lang.String outputDir,
                              Differencer differencer,
                              sofya.ed.structural.JUnitEventDispatcher dispatcher)
Creates a result printer with specified configuration.

Parameters:
writer - Writer to which JUnit outputs should be directed. When outputDir is set, this will be limited to certain outputs of the JUnit tool itself instead of test outputs. May be null, in which case outputs will be sent to stdout (System.out).
outputDir - Directory to which output files and traces should be automatically saved. May be null, in which case outputs are not saved to file.
differencer - Diffing module to be used for comparing outputs; can be used even when outputDir is null. May be null, in which case outputs will not be diffed.
dispatcher - Instance of JUnitEventDispatcher to be used to interface with instrumented subject classes. It should be configured externally, however the result printer needs a reference in order to produce trace files at the appropriate times. May be null, in which case tests are not traced (and will produce errors if the subject is instrumented).
Method Detail

setWriter

public void setWriter(java.io.Writer writer)
Sets the writer to which outputs should be directed. If an output directory is also specified, the redirection of test outputs to file(s) will override this setting, but certain tool outputs will still be directed to this stream.

Parameters:
writer - Writer to which the outputs should be written. May be null, in which case outputs will be directed to stdout.

getWriter

public java.io.Writer getWriter()
Gets the writer to which outputs are currently being written.

Warning: The writer may be attached to System.out, so exercise caution if closing the stream!

Returns:
The writer to which outputs are currently being written.

setOutputDir

public void setOutputDir(java.lang.String outputDir)
Sets the output directory to which test outputs should be saved (in files). Trace files are also copied to this directory.

Parameters:
outputDir - Path of the directory to which outputs are to be saved. May be null, in which case saving of outputs to file is disabled.

getOutputDir

public java.lang.String getOutputDir()
Gets the directory to which outputs are set to be saved.

Returns:
The directory where test outputs are being saved to files.

setDifferencer

public void setDifferencer(Differencer differencer)
Sets the differencing module to be used for comparing test outputs. May be used even if outputDir is not set.

Parameters:
differencer - Differencing module for use in comparison of test outputs. May be null, in which case outputs will not be diffed.

getDifferencer

public Differencer getDifferencer()
Gets the differencing module currently being used to compare test outputs.

Returns:
The differencing module which is currently in use for diffing test outputs.

setDispatcher

public void setDispatcher(sofya.ed.structural.JUnitEventDispatcher dispatcher)
Sets the JUnitEventDispatcher that will be used to trace an instrumented subject and generate trace files.

Parameters:
dispatcher - Instance of JUnitEventDispatcher to be used for handling an instrumented subject; should be configured externally.

getDispatcher

public sofya.ed.structural.JUnitEventDispatcher getDispatcher()
Gets the JUnitEventDispatcher that is being used to trace an instrumented subject.

Returns:
The event dispatcher that is handling the instrumented subject and producing trace files.

setLevelClass

public void setLevelClass(boolean enable)
Sets whether the test case granularity is classes or methods.

Parameters:
enable - true to set the granularity level to classes, false to set the granularity level to methods.

isLevelClass

public boolean isLevelClass()
Reports whether the test case granularity is classes or methods.

Returns:
true if the granularity level is classes, false if the granularity level is methods.

startInit

protected void startInit()
Respond to event indicating that initialization of the test suite has begun.

Static initializers in instrumented subject classes may run as a result of the test suite initialization (loading), so the event dispatcher is notified to begin capturing those events to a special trace file (if appropriate).

endInit

protected void endInit()
Respond to event indicating that intialization of the test suite has completed.

Static initializers in instrumented subject classes may run as a result of the test suite initialization (loading), so the filter is notified to write the trace file recording those events, (if appropriate).

printSummary

protected void printSummary(junit.framework.TestResult result,
                            long runTime)
Print summary of test suite execution.

Parameters:
result - TestResult containing the results of execution of the test suite.
runTime - Running time of this execution of the test suite.

Returns the formatted string of the elapsed time. Duplicated from BaseTestRunner. Fix it.
